See list of talks for more information about the talks and links to download slides.

Monday 5 December

Time Description
8:50 - 9:20 registration
9:20 - 9:30 opening
  chair: Bartosz Regula
9:30 - 10:00 Francesco Buscemi
A hierarchy of resource theories of quantum incompatibility
10:05 - 10:25 Beata Zjawin
Quantifying EPR: the resource theory of nonclassicality of common-cause assemblages
10:30 - 10:50 Simon Milz
Resource Theory of Causal Connection
10:55 - 11:30 coffee
  chair: Mile Gu
11:30 - 12:00 Eric Chitambar
Delay times as quantum resource primitives
12:05 - 12:25 Hlér Kristjánsson
Resource theories of communication and coherent routing of information
12:30 - 12:50 Graeme Berk
Resource Theories and Noise Reduction
12:55 - 14:00 lunch
  chair: Mario Berta
14:00 - 14:30 Marco Tomamichel
When resource monotones become additive
14:35 - 14:55 Hayata Yamasaki
General Quantum Resource Theories: Maximal Resources, Catalytic Replication, and Asymptotically Consistent Measures
15:00 - 15:20 Andrés Ducuara
Characterisation of quantum betting tasks in terms of Arimoto mutual information
15:25 - 16:00 coffee
16:00 - 17:30 discussions

All talks take place in the Merchant Court Ballroom of Paradox Hotel. Coffee breaks and registration take place in the foyer just outside the Ballroom. The lunch is served at Ellenborough Market Cafe, right next to the foyer.

Tuesday 6 December

Time Description
  chair: Eric Chitambar
9:30 - 10:00 Alexander Streltsov
Entanglement catalysis for quantum states and noisy channels
10:05 - 10:25 Roberto Rubboli
Fundamental Limits on Correlated Catalytic State Transformations
10:30 - 10:50 Patryk Lipka-Bartosik
Finite-size catalysis in quantum resource theories
10:55 - 11:30 coffee
  chair: Kamil Korzekwa
11:30 - 12:00 Ludovico Lami
Testing quantumness without entanglement
12:05 - 12:25 Ryuji Takagi
Correlation in Catalysts Enables Arbitrary Manipulation of Quantum Coherence
12:30 - 12:50 Jeongrak Son
Catalysis in Action via Elementary Thermal Operations
12:55 - 14:00 lunch
  chair: Christoph Hirche
14:00 - 14:20 Robert Salzmann
Symmetric distinguishability as a quantum resource
14:25 - 14:45 Sebastian Horvat
Accessing inaccessible information via quantum indistinguishability
14:50 - 15:10 Roberto Salazar
Resource Theory of Absolute Negativity
15:15 - 15:35 Chung-Yun Hsieh
Quantum channel marginal problem / Resource Marginal Problems
15:40 - 16:40 coffee and posters
16:40 - 18:00 discussions
   
18:30 - 20:45 conference dinner
(leaving from the hotel at 18:15)

The talks and the poster session will take place in the Ballroom.

The conference dinner will take place in the restaurant Peach Garden, located on the 33th floor of the OCBC Centre (65 Chulia St, Singapore 049513). We will leave from Paradox Hotel at 18:15 and walk to the restaurant. Participants who wish to go to the dinner venue directly should arrive no later than 18:45.
